result.execSummary:
The defendant Robert Lee Wade was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Attempt Robbery of a Financial Institution, a class C felony, Wisconsin Statutes 943.87.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes:
Provide DNA sample- pay surcharge.
Pay all applicable mandatory surcharges, fees, assessments, and costs.

The Court ordered that all financial obligations be paid through collection of sums by the Department of Corrections from 25% of funds under Sec. 973.05(4)(b) and as a condition of extended supervision. Any amount remaining due and owing is subject to civil judgment.

superMiscConds.notes:
Seek and maintain employment.
Participate in job and vocational training.

No controlled substances or alcohol.
No contact with victims Novia L., Latoya R., and Chase Bank located at 210 W. Capital Drive, Glendale

Cognitive thinking intervention counseling.
Participate in Parenting counseling.
Anger Management counseling/program.

AODA assessment; treatment, if needed.
Urine screens.
The Court advised defendant that as a convicted felon not to possess any firearms or body armor. Court further advised defendant of voting ineligibility.

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Robert Lee Wade

records.descr: Records of prosec. are converted data. See file.

records.addlTxt: -Received, filed and electronically signed by the Court on September 8, 2017.   Deputy Court Clerk: TC.
Per Order of the Presiding Judge, Felony Division, this motion/request is hereby assigned to the Hon. Joseph R. Wall, Br. 20, calendar successor, for review. mag
To and from Robert L. Wade, received and filed.

Order on Petition for Determination of Eligibility for the Substance Abuse Program, filed and signed by the Court.  The petition is denied, the Court already made this determination at sentencing, Judge Moroney did not approve of any release program of this nature.   Copies forwarded to parties.
Per order of Presiding Judge, Felony Division, this request/motion is hereby assigned to the Hon. Stephanie G. Rothstein, Br. 25, for review. jbs
/from Mr. Wade to the court seeking eligibility for ERP.
Certification of transcript of proceedings of SENTENCING HEARING commencing 07/07/2015 received and filed. (20 Pages.)

Attorney Alexis B Stewart in court, defendant Robert Lee Wade not in court, in custody.  Sara Nicole Volden Schroeder appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Branch 20 in trial.  Case is adjourned for sentencing before Branch 20.  Sentencing hearing scheduled for July 7, 2015 at 08:30 am.
Court ordered defendant REMANDED into the custody of the Milwaukee County Sheriff's Department.

Defendant Robert Lee Wade in court with attorney Alexis B Stewart.  Defendant Robert Lee Wade in custody.  Sara Nicole Volden Schroeder appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Plea hearing proceeds.  Defendant was advised of constitutional rights and maximum penalties, and further advised that if not a United States citizen deportation is possible. Defendant sworn, examined as to plea, and entered a plea of guilty.  Court found defendant freely, voluntarily and intelligently waived all constitutional rights. Plea questionnaire waiver of rights and addendum to plea questionnaire received and filed. Parties stipulated to the criminal complaint as factual basis to sustain defendant's plea. Court found defendant guilty as charged in the Information and ordered a Judgment of Conviction be entered into the record.  The Court advised defendant that as a convicted felon not to possess any firearms or body armor.    Court further advised defendant of voting ineligibility.  Court ordered case adjourned for sentencing in Branch 20.  Sentencing hearing scheduled for June 18, 2015 at 01:30 pm.

Attorney Alexis B Stewart in court, defendant Robert Lee Wade not in court, in custody.  Sara Nicole Volden Schroeder appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Defense counsel requested another date to resolve pending DV cases first.  File retained in court.  Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for April 30, 2015 at 08:30 am.

Attorney Alexis B Stewart in court, defendant Robert Lee Wade not in court, in custody.  Sara Nicole Volden Schroeder appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Defense counsel requested a plea and sentencing date.  Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for April 23, 2015 at 08:30 am.

Attorney Alexis B Stewart in court by telephone, defendant Robert Lee Wade not in court, in custody.  Sara Nicole Volden Schroeder appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Case is adjourned for another scheduling conference.  File retained in court.  Scheduling conference scheduled for March 18, 2015 at 08:30 am.

Defendant Robert Lee Wade in court with attorney Alexis B Stewart.  Defendant Robert Lee Wade in custody.  Sara Nicole Volden Schroeder appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  
Defendant waived Preliminary Hearing.  Preliminary Hearing Questionnaire and Waiver received and filed. Court found probable cause and bound defendant over for trial.  Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge Moroney, Branch 20.  Original Information filed.  Copy given to defense counsel who waived reading.  Defendant pled not guilty. Court ordered case adjourned for Scheduling Conference in Branch 20.  Scheduling conference scheduled for March 10, 2015 at 01:30 pm.

Court ordered defendant TURNED OVER TO Justice Point for Electronic Monitoring and Supervision.  ABSOLUTE SOBRIETY to be monitored by drug testing and portable breathalyzers.  No possession of dangerous weapons or firearms.  Defendant advised it is a requirement to attend all future court proceedings.  Failure to comply with conditions of bail may result in an additional charge of bail jumping.
Signed and filed, No Contact Order.  Defendant to have no contact with Chase Bank at it's employees or Latoya R

Defendant Robert Lee Wade in court with attorney Stephen Andrew Sargent.  Defendant Robert Lee Wade in custody.  Carole Manchester appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy Court Clerk:  bm
  Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge Moroney, Branch 20.  Defendant given a copy of the complaint and advised of maximum penalties, right to counsel and right to a preliminary hearing.  Court reviewed complaint and found probable cause to hold defendant for further proceedings. DEFENDANT IS INDIGENT AND PUBLIC DEFENDER WILL PROVIDE COUNSEL.  Preliminary hearing scheduled for March 4, 2015 at 08:30 am.
